params.name: logger
params.description:
A logger to be used by
this middleware. The middleware will be interacting with the logger
to track Stackdriver request trace ID. It also properly sets
env[“rack.logger”] to this assigned logger for accessing. If not
specified, a default logger with be used.

params.name: *kwargs
params.description: Hash of configuration settings. Used for backward API compatibility. See the Configuration Guide for the prefered way to set configuration parameters.

methods.name: call
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Middleware#call
methods.description: Rack middleware entry point. In most Rack based frameworks, a request is served by one thread. So entry point, we associate the GCP request trace_id with the current thread’s object_id in logger. All the logs written by logger beyond this point will carry this request’s trace_id. Untrack the trace_id with this thread upon exiting.

returns.description: The response from downstream Rack app

methods.name: build_monitored_resource
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Middleware.build_monitored_resource
methods.description: Construct a monitored resource based on the given type and label if both are provided. Otherwise, construct a default monitored resource based on the current environment.

examples.caption: If both type and labels are provided, it returns resource:
If running from GAE, returns default resource:
examples.code:
rc = Google::Cloud::Logging::Middleware.build_monitored_resource
rc.type   #=> "gae_app"
rc.labels # { module_id: [GAE module name],
          #   version_id: [GAE module version] }

examples.caption: If running from GKE, returns default resource:
examples.code:
rc = Google::Cloud::Logging::Middleware.build_monitored_resource
rc.type   #=> "container"
rc.labels # { cluster_name: [GKE cluster name],
          #   namespace_id: [GKE namespace_id] }

examples.caption: If running from GCE, return default resource:
examples.code:
rc = Google::Cloud::Logging::Middleware.build_monitored_resource
rc.type   #=> "gce_instance"
rc.labels # { instance_id: [GCE VM instance id],
          #   zone: [GCE vm group zone] }

returns.description:
An Resource object with
type and labels
